Subsection.Text: A hospital is exempt from the application of section 21.8 of the Act in respect of the reporting of information referred to in subsection (1) if the hospital does not have in its control all of the information referred to in paragraphs (1)(b) and (c).
In this section, hospital means a facility

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that is licensed, approved or designated as a hospital by a province in accordance with the laws of the province to provide care or treatment to individuals suffering from any form of disease or illness; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: that is operated by the Government of Canada and that provides health services to in-patients.

Subsection.Text: For greater certainty,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in this section, serious adverse drug reaction has the same meaning as in subsection 1(2); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: nothing in this section affects the application of section C.01.020.1 of the Food and Drug Regulations.

Section.Text: The holder of the market authorization for a biocide must provide the Minister with the following information in writing within 30 days after the day on which the biocide, as packaged and labelled for sale to consumers, is first sold in Canada under the authorization:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the biocide’s identification number;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the first sale;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the names and contact information of the persons that are packaging or labelling the biocide, excluding individuals who are employees or agents of such persons, and the civic addresses of the locations where the biocide is packaged or labelled; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of all labels that are being used in connection with the biocide.

Section.Text: The holder of the market authorization for a biocide must, before October 1 of each year and in the manner specified by the Minister, inform the Minister of whether or not they are selling the biocide in Canada or have sold it in Canada in the 12 months preceding that date.

Subsection.Text: The holder of the market authorization for a biocide — or, if the market authorization has been revoked, the former holder — must provide the Minister with the following information in writing within 30 days after the day on which they permanently discontinue the sale of the biocide in Canada:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the biocide’s identification number;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which they discontinued the sale of the biocide; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: subject to subsection (5), the latest expiry date of the biocide that they have sold under the authorization and the applicable lot number.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of subsection (1), the holder of the market authorization for a biocide that has not sold the biocide in Canada under the authorization and that decides that they will not sell the biocide under the authorization is deemed to have permanently discontinued the sale of the biocide in Canada on the day on which they made that decision.
Paragraphs (1)(b) and (c) do not apply to a holder referred to in subsection (2).

Subject to subsection (5), if a holder referred to in subsection (2) sold the biocide under a registration under the Pest Control Products Act or under a drug identification number assigned under the Food and Drug Regulations, the holder must, when providing information to the Minister under subsection (1), also provide the latest expiry date of the biocide that they sold under the registration or the drug identification number, as the case may be, and the lot number, if applicable.

The holder or former holder must provide the information referred to in paragraph (1)(c) or subsection (4) if the holder permanently discontinues the sale of the biocide or makes the decision referred to in subsection (2), as the case may be, before the last day of the month of the latest expiry date of the biocide that they sold under the market authorization or under the registration or drug identification number referred to in subsection (4).

Any person that has sold a biocide must maintain a system of control, including records, that permits the complete and rapid recall of the biocide from the persons to whom they have sold it, other than consumers that purchased the biocide at the retail level.
The person must retain each record

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case where an expiry date is shown on the label of the biocide to which the record relates, for a period that ends no earlier than the last day of the month that is shown as the expiry date; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in any other case, for at least six years after the day on which the person sold the biocide to which the record relates.

Subsection.Text: If any of the following persons decides to recall a biocide that is the subject of a market authorization without being ordered to do so by the Minister, the person must, within 24 hours after making the decision, provide the Minister with the information set out in subsection (2), in writing:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the holder of the market authorization;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an importer of the biocide; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a person that manufactures the biocide and sells it.

Subsection.Text: The information to be provided is as follows:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the biocide’s brand names;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the biocide’s identification number;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the names and contact information of the persons that manufactured the biocide, excluding individuals who are employees or agents of such persons, and, in the case of a recall by the holder, the names and contact information of any importers;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name and contact information of the individual who is responsible for the recall;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the lot numbers, dates of manufacture and expiry dates of the biocide that is being recalled;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity of the biocide that was manufactured in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity of the biocide that was imported;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity of the biocide that the person sold to persons in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the period during which the person sold the biocide in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity of the biocide that the person exported from Canada, as well as the quantity exported, by country;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity of the biocide that is in Canada and that remains in the possession or control of the person;

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: the names of the persons in Canada, other than consumers that purchased the biocide at the retail level, to whom the biocide was sold by the person and the quantity sold to each of the named persons;

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: the classes of persons from whom the biocide is being recalled;

Paragraph.Label: (n)
Paragraph.Text: the expected dates for the start and completion of the recall;

Paragraph.Label: (o)
Paragraph.Text: the reason for the recall and the date on which, and the manner in which, the situation that prompted the recall was discovered;

Paragraph.Label: (p)
Paragraph.Text: an assessment of the risk of injury to human health posed by the biocide that is being recalled, including because of a failure of its effectiveness; and

Paragraph.Label: (q)
Paragraph.Text: a description of any other measures that the person is taking in respect of the recall.

Subsection.Text: The person must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: before starting the recall, provide the Minister with a copy of the communications that they intend to use in connection with starting the recall; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: after starting the recall, provide the Minister, on request and within the time specified by the Minister, with a copy of any additional communications that they use, or intend to use, in connection with the recall.

Subsection.Text: The person must, within 72 hours after making the decision to recall the biocide, provide the Minister with the following information in writing:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the strategy for conducting the recall, including the time and manner in which the Minister will be informed of the progress of the recall; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the measures that are intended to be taken to prevent a recurrence of the situation that prompted the recall.

Subsection.Text: The person must, within 30 days after completing the recall, provide the Minister with the following information in writing:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the results of the recall; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the measures that have been or will be taken to prevent a recurrence of the situation that prompted the recall.

Subsection.Text: A person that is ordered by the Minister to recall a biocide under section 21.3 of the Act must provide the Minister with the following information in the time and manner specified by the Minister:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name, title and contact information of an individual from whom the Minister may obtain additional information concerning the recall;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if known, the names and contact information of the persons that manufactured the biocide that is being recalled, excluding individuals who are employees or agents of such persons, and the names and contact information of any importers;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the total quantity of the biocide that has been sold by the person at the retail level to consumers in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: if the person has sold the biocide to persons in Canada other than consumers referred to in paragraph (c),

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the names of each of those persons and the quantity of the biocide that has been sold to each of them, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the period during which the biocide was sold to those persons;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity of the biocide that the person has exported from Canada, as well as the quantity exported, by country;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity of the biocide that is in Canada and that remains in the possession or control of the person;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the strategy for conducting the recall;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: any other information that the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe is necessary to mitigate the risk of injury to human health; and

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: if the person is in a position to prevent a recurrence of the situation that prompted the recall, a description of the measures that they intend to take to prevent a recurrence.

Subsection.Text: The person must notify the Minister without delay of any change to the information referred to in paragraph (1)(a).
The person must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: before starting the recall, provide the Minister with a copy of the communications that they intend to use in connection with starting the recall; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: after starting the recall, provide the Minister, on request and within the time specified by the Minister, with a copy of any additional communications that they use, or intend to use, in connection with the recall.

Subsection.Text: The person must notify the Minister in writing, within 24 hours, of the start and completion of the recall.
The person must, within 30 days after completing the recall, provide the Minister with the following information in writing:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the results of the recall; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the person is in a position to prevent a recurrence of the situation that prompted the recall, a description of the measures that they have taken or will take to prevent a recurrence.

Section.MarginalNote: Prohibition — failure to follow master formula

Subsection.Text: It is prohibited for the holder of the market authorization for a biocide or the importer of a biocide to sell the biocide unless the biocide has been manufactured, packaged, labelled and stored in accordance with the master formula for the biocide.

It is prohibited for a person that manufactures, packages or labels a biocide that is the subject of a market authorization to sell the biocide if they have failed to manufacture, package or label it, as the case may be, in accordance with the master formula for the biocide or have failed to store it in accordance with the master formula.

The holder of the market authorization for a biocide and the importer of a biocide must maintain records that demonstrate that each lot or batch of the biocide that they sell has been manufactured, packaged, labelled and stored in accordance with the master formula for the biocide.

Any person that manufactures, packages or labels a biocide that is the subject of a market authorization must, for each lot or batch of the biocide that they sell, maintain records demonstrating that they have manufactured, packaged or labelled, as the case may be, the lot or batch in accordance with the master formula for the biocide and have stored it in accordance with the master formula.

The holder, importer or person must — even if they cease to hold the market authorization or no longer import or sell the biocide, as the case may be — retain each record for at least one year after the last day of the month in which the shelf life of the biocide ends or, if that day cannot be determined, for at least six years after the day on which they sold the biocide.

Anyone that is required to retain a record under subsection (3) must provide the information in the record to the Minister, on request, within five days after the request is made or, if the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that there is a serious and imminent risk of injury to human health, within any shorter period specified by the Minister.

Section.Text: It is prohibited to manufacture or package a biocide that is intended to be sterile unless the manufacturing or packaging is carried out

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in a separate and enclosed area;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: under the supervision of an individual who is trained in microbiology; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: using a method that is scientifically proven to ensure the sterility of the biocide.

Subsection.Text: If any of the following persons receives a complaint in respect of the quality of a biocide that is the subject of a market authorization, the person must investigate it and, if necessary, take corrective action:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the holder of the market authorization;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an importer of the biocide; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a person that manufactures, packages or labels the biocide and sells it.

Subsection.Text: The person must maintain a record of each complaint and investigation and any corrective action taken.
The person must — even if they cease to hold the market authorization or no longer import or sell the biocide, as the case may be — retain each record for at least one year after the latest of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the last day of the month in which the shelf life of the biocide to which the complaint relates ends, if that day can be determined,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if no corrective action is taken, the day on which the investigation is completed, and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if corrective action is taken, the day on which the action is completed.

Subsection.Text: Anyone that is required to retain a record under subsection (3) must provide the information in the record to the Minister, on request, within five days after the request is made or, if the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that there is a serious and imminent risk of injury to human health, within any shorter period specified by the Minister.

Section.MarginalNote: Temporary exemptions — Pest Control Products Act

Subsection.Text: A biocide that is a pest control product is exempt from the application of these Regulations — other than sections 10, 11 and 26 — if the biocide is registered under the Pest Control Products Act and the registration is made either

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: before the first anniversary of the day on which these Regulations are registered; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of registration on the basis of an application referred to in subsection (3), on or after that anniversary.

Subsection.Text: The exemption referred to in subsection (1) ceases to apply on the earliest of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the day on which the registration ceases;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the day on which the Minister makes a final decision in respect of an application for a market authorization for the biocide;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the day on which an application for a market authorization for the biocide is withdrawn; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the fifth anniversary of the day on which these Regulations are registered.

Subsection.Text: A biocide that is a pest control product is exempt from the application of these Regulations — other than sections 10, 11 and 26 — if, immediately before the first anniversary of the day on which these Regulations are registered,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the biocide is the subject of an application for registration under the Pest Control Products Act; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: no final decision has been made in respect of the application.

Subsection.Text: The exemption referred to in subsection (3) ceases to apply on the earliest of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the day on which the Minister makes a final decision in respect of the application for registration under the Pest Control Products Act;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the day on which the application for registration under the Pest Control Products Act is withdrawn;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the day on which the Minister makes a final decision in respect of an application for a market authorization for the biocide;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the day on which an application for a market authorization for the biocide is withdrawn; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the fifth anniversary of the day on which these Regulations are registered.

Subsection.Text: The information referred to in paragraphs 10(1)(h), (i) and (l) — other than information relating to the net quantity of the biocide in the package, the type of its package and the properties and qualities of the packaging material — may be omitted from an application for a market authorization for a biocide that is exempt from the application of these Regulations under subsection 66(1) if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the application is submitted under section 10; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the information referred to in paragraphs 10(1)(c) to (g) that is set out in the application corresponds to the relevant conditions of registration under the Pest Control Products Act.

Subsection.Text: In subsection (1), conditions of registration has the same meaning as in subsection 2(1) of the Pest Control Products Act.

Section.MarginalNote: Temporary exemptions — Food and Drug Regulations

Subsection.Text: A biocide is exempt from the application of these Regulations — other than sections 10, 11 and 26 — if the biocide is a drug

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to which a drug identification number has been assigned under the Food and Drug Regulations

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: before the first anniversary of the day on which these Regulations are registered, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a drug identification number that is assigned on the basis of an application referred to in subsection (3), on or after that anniversary; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: whose drug identification number has not been cancelled.

Subsection.Text: The exemption referred to in subsection (1) ceases to apply on the earliest of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the day on which the drug identification number is cancelled under the Food and Drug Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the day on which the Minister makes a final decision in respect of an application for a market authorization for the biocide;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the day on which an application for a market authorization for the biocide is withdrawn; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the fifth anniversary of the day on which these Regulations are registered.

Subsection.Text: A biocide is exempt from the application of these Regulations — other than sections 10, 11 and 26 — if, immediately before the first anniversary of the day on which these Regulations are registered,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the biocide is a drug that is the subject of an application for a drug identification number that is made under section C.01.014.1 of the Food and Drug Regulations or of a new drug submission that is filed under section C.08.002 of those Regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: no final decision has been made in respect of the application or submission.

Subsection.Text: The exemption referred to in subsection (3) ceases to apply on the earliest of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the day on which the Minister makes a final decision in respect of the application or submission under the Food and Drug Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the day on which the application or submission is withdrawn;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the day on which the Minister makes a final decision in respect of an application for a market authorization for the biocide;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the day on which an application for a market authorization for the biocide is withdrawn; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the fifth anniversary of the day on which these Regulations are registered.

Section.Text: The information referred to in paragraphs 10(1)(h), (i), (l) and (n) — other than information relating to the net quantity of the biocide in the package, the type of package and the properties and qualities of the packaging material — may be omitted from an application for a market authorization for a biocide that is exempt from the application of these Regulations under subsection 68(1) if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the application is submitted under section 10; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the information referred to in paragraphs 10(1)(c) to (g) that is set out in the application corresponds to the relevant matters that are authorized in respect of the biocide under the Food and Drug Regulations.

Subsection.Text: A surface sanitizer for use in food premises is exempt from the application of these Regulations — other than sections 10, 11 and 26 — if, immediately before the first anniversary of the day on which these Regulations are registered,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a drug identification number has not been assigned to the surface sanitizer for use in food premises under the Food and Drug Regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the surface sanitizer for use in food premises is not a pest control product that is registered under the Pest Control Products Act.

Subsection.Text: The exemption ceases to apply on the earliest of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the day on which the Minister makes a final decision in respect of an application for a market authorization for the surface sanitizer for use in food premises;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the day on which an application for a market authorization for the surface sanitizer for use in food premises is withdrawn; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the seventh anniversary of the day on which these Regulations are registered.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Definition of surface sanitizer for use in food premises
Subsection.Text: In this section, surface sanitizer for use in food premises means a biocide that is manufactured, sold or represented for use exclusively in premises in which food is manufactured, prepared or kept for sale.

Section.Text: The information referred to in subparagraph 15(3)(c)(ii) or (iii), as those subparagraphs read immediately before the fifth anniversary of the day on which these Regulations were registered, must be set out in a market authorization if that information was required to be set out in the authorization under subparagraph 12(1)(o)(ii), as that subparagraph read immediately before that anniversary.

Section.Text: Subsection 10(1) of these Regulations is amended by adding “and” at the end of paragraph (m) and by repealing paragraphs (o) and (p).
Subparagraph 12(1)(o)(ii) of these Regulations is replaced by the following:

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the other biocide’s identification number.

Subsection.Text: Paragraphs 15(3)(a) to (i) of these Regulations are replaced by the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the market authorization for the biocide was issued on the basis of an application that met the applicable conditions set out in subsection 10(2);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the application is submitted on the basis of a comparison between the version of the biocide that is affected by the major change and a version of the other biocide referred to in paragraph 10(2)(a) that is also affected by the major change (referred to in paragraphs (c) to (k) as “the other biocide”);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the other biocide is the subject of a market authorization;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the application contains the other biocide’s identification number;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the application contains information that demonstrates that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: for a given quantity of biocide, the version of the biocide that is affected by the major change contains the same active ingredients in the same quantities as the other biocide,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the formulants that the version of the biocide that is affected by the major change contains are among the formulants that the other biocide may contain under its market authorization,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: for a given quantity of biocide, the quantity of each formulant that the version of the biocide that is affected by the major change contains is the same as the quantity of that formulant that the other biocide may contain under its market authorization,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subparagraph (v), the conditions of use of the version of the biocide that is affected by the major change fall within the conditions of use of the other biocide, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the version of the biocide that is affected by the major change has the same risk information and directions for storage as the other biocide;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the application contains, if the applicant is not the holder of the market authorization for the other biocide, an attestation, by an individual who has authority to bind the holder, that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: confirms that either

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the major change resulted in an amendment to the master formula for the other biocide and the holder provided the applicant with the updated master formula for the other biocide, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the major change did not result in an amendment to the master formula for the other biocide, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: mentions the other biocide’s brand names and identification number;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the application contains an attestation, by an individual who has authority to bind the applicant, that confirms that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: if the major change resulted in an amendment to the master formula for the other biocide, the version of the biocide that is affected by the major change will be manufactured in accordance with the updated master formula for the other biocide, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the specifications for the version of the biocide that is affected by the major change — other than in respect of the net quantity of the biocide in the package, the type of its package and the properties and qualities of the packaging material — are the same as those for the other biocide;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has provided to the holder of the market authorization for the other biocide a notice of acceptance in respect of the major change;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the other biocide’s market authorization is not suspended;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: in the case referred to in subsection (4), the other biocide was not registered under the Pest Control Products Act on the basis of a comparison to a third biocide that is a pest control product; and

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: in the case referred to in subsection (5), the drug identification number assigned to the other biocide under the Food and Drug Regulations was not assigned on the basis of a comparison to a third biocide.

Subsection.Text: Subsections 15(4) and (5) of these Regulations are replaced by the following:

Subsection.MarginalNote: Deemed comparison — Pest Control Products Act
Subsection.Text: If a biocide that was exempted from the application of these Regulations under subsection 66(1) was registered under the Pest Control Products Act on the basis of a comparison to another biocide that is a pest control product and that other biocide is the subject of a market authorization, the following rules apply:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for the purposes of paragraph (3)(a), the biocide’s market authorization is deemed to have been issued on the basis of an application that met the applicable conditions set out in subsection 10(2); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for the purposes of paragraph (3)(b), that other biocide is deemed to be the other biocide referred to in paragraph 10(2)(a).

Subsection.MarginalNote: Deemed comparison — Food and Drug Regulations
Subsection.Text: If a biocide that was exempted from the application of these Regulations under subsection 68(1) had been assigned a drug identification number under the Food and Drug Regulations on the basis of a comparison to another biocide and that other biocide is the subject of a market authorization, the following rules apply:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for the purposes of paragraph (3)(a), the biocide’s market authorization is deemed to have been issued on the basis of an application that met the applicable conditions set out in subsection 10(2); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for the purposes of paragraph (3)(b), that other biocide is deemed to be the other biocide referred to in paragraph 10(2)(a).

Subsection.Text: Subsection 15(9) of these Regulations is replaced by the following:
In subsection (3), applicant means the holder of a market authorization for a biocide that submits an application for a notice of acceptance in respect of a major change under subsection (2).
Subsection 15(10) of these Regulations is repealed.
